Class QuizzesConstants

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wiris.quizzes.api.QuizzesConstants

  • public class QuizzesConstants
extends java.lang.Object
    Constant values useful in Wiris Quizzes API.

      • OPTION_FLOAT_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_FLOAT_FORMAT
        Output option. String defining the output format for floating point numbers. The format syntax is: [flags][.precision]conversion - Flags:
        NameFormatDescription
        Digit grouping',' Whether to separate digits in groups using the digit group separator string (defined in options section).
        - Conversion: The required conversion is one or two characters indicating how the argument should be formatted. The m character is the prefix for extensions of the printf standard provided by Wiris Quizzes.
        NameFormatDescription
        Computerized scientific'e', 'E' The result is formatted as a decimal number in computerized scientific notation with 'e' or 'E' symbol respectively. For example 6.022E+23. Precision is the number of significant digits.
        Fixed decimal'f' The result is formatted as a decimal number. Precision is the number of digits after the decimal mark.
        Computerized automatic'g', 'G' The result is formatted using computerized scientific notation or decimal format, depending on the precision and the value after rounding, with 'e' or 'E' symbol respectively. Precision is the number of significant digits.
        Scientific'me' The result is formatted as a decimal number in standard scientific notation: 1.03·10^23. Precision is the number of significant digits.
        Automatic'mg' The same as 'g', but using 'me' instead of 'e' when scientific notation is needed.
        Floating decimal'mr' The result is formatted as a decimal number with floating point notation. Precision is the number of significant digits.
        - Precision: If conversion is 'f' the precision is the number of digits after the decimal separator. If the conversion is 'e', 'E', 'g', 'G', 'me', 'mg' or 'mr' the precision is the total number of digits in the resulting magnitude after rounding. If not specified, the precision is the value of the separate option "precision"; otherwise it is overwritten by this value. The default format is "mg".
        See Also:
        Question.setOption(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_DECIMAL_SEPARATOR

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_DECIMAL_SEPARATOR

      • OPTION_DIGIT_GROUP_SEPARATOR

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_DIGIT_GROUP_SEPARATOR
        Output option. Character for digits group (thousands) separator.
        See Also:
        Question.setOption(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER
        Whether to include the student answer as algorithm parameter. If set to true, the student answer(s) will be available in the question algorithm as parameters. The name of the parameter is set by the option OPTION_STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER_NAME.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPTION_STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String OPTION_STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER_NAME
        The name of the algorithm's parameter for the student answer. If there is more than one student answer, actual parameter name will be the value of this local data concatenated with the index of the answer starting from 1.
        See Also:
        OPTION_STUDENT_ANSWER_PARAMETER, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE
        The question property key for the type of answer input field.
        See Also:
        ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_INLINE_EDITOR, ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_POPUP_EDITOR, ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_TEXT, Question.setProperty(PropertyName, String), Constant Field Values

      • ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_INLINE_EDITOR

        public static final java.lang.String ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_INLINE_EDITOR
        Answer field type. The field is an embedded MathType.
        See Also:
        Question.setAnswerFieldType(com.wiris.quizzes.api.ui.AnswerFieldType), Constant Field Values

      • ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_POPUP_EDITOR

        public static final java.lang.String ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_POPUP_EDITOR
        Answer field type. The field is a text field with an icon to the right that shows a MathType in a popup where the user can enter an equation. The text field eventually gets replaced by an image with the equation.
        See Also:
        Question.setAnswerFieldType(com.wiris.quizzes.api.ui.AnswerFieldType), Constant Field Values

      • ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_TEXT

        public static final java.lang.String ANSWER_FIELD_TYPE_TEXT
        Answer field type. The field is a standard HTML plain text input field.
        See Also:
        Question.setAnswerFieldType(com.wiris.quizzes.api.ui.AnswerFieldType), Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER
        Whether the question with open answer is compound. If enabled, the response becomes a set of responses with the form "label = value", where "value" are the actual answers. Allowed values: true or false.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_TRUE, PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_FALSE, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_TRUE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_TRUE
        Enable compound answer.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_FALSE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_FALSE
        Disable compound answer.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE
        The method to combine the grades of each answer in a compound answer question.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_AND, PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTE, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_AND

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_AND
        Logic and operator on the grades: all answers in a compound answer question must be correct.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTE
        Each answer contributes with a weight to the total grade of the question.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE, PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTION, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTION

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTION
        If the compound answer grade method is PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTE, the grade distribution string. The value must be a space separated list of percentages, such as "20% 40% 40%".
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_VALUE_COMPOUND_ANSWER_GRADE_DISTRIBUTE, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_SHOW_CAS

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_SHOW_CAS
        Whether to show a Computer Algebra System (CAS) to the student. Concretely, an instance of CalcMe (www.calcme.com) will be shown to the student so they can use it for auxiliar computations
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_FALSE, PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_ADD, PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_REPLACE, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_FALSE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_FALSE
        Don't show any auxiliary CAS to the student.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_SHOW_CAS, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_ADD

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_ADD
        Add a CAS before the answer input field.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_SHOW_CAS, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_REPLACE

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_VALUE_SHOW_CAS_REPLACE
        Replace the input field by the CAS. That option is for manually-graded questions only.
        See Also:
        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), PROPERTY_SHOW_CAS, Constant Field Values

      • PROPERTY_CAS_INITIAL_SESSION

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_CAS_INITIAL_SESSION
        The CalcMe session to be initially loaded into the auxiliary CAS.

        Question.setProperty(com.wiris.quizzes.api.PropertyName, java.lang.String), Constant Field Values

        public static final java.lang.String PROPERTY_CAS_SESSION
